page.title: 16Old Raisins Farm, Harpenden.
page.content: Where{Sauncey Wood Lane}meets{Holly {Lane}there stands a house on a spot where there was a dwelling in{1086 when the first{Domesday Book}was written. It would have had earth floors covered with reeds and it probably burned down. Records of a house on this site in{1492}are in {Kimpton Parish Church.}The present farm house which still has, in the roof, some of the original timbers was built by{Edward Reason}around{1607.}So perhaps it should be called Reason's, as local people pronounce it. Edward Reason was tall for those times,{6ft. That's why its roof is higher than usual in such an old house. It would have been{a fine house}for those days. When the present{Hatfield House}was being built, some bricks from the{old {palace}were taken and they can be seen in the{end wall}of Raisins Farm today.
